column3: Setup: Carry out a number of activities which generate notifications visible to your user account OR
Setup: Ask the development team to run the make_notifications script for your user account to generate a selection of realistic notifications for you

Go to the Managing Editor's dashboard

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//dashboard
Click on the Notification menu item on the top bar

column4: You are taken to the notification search page
You can see the first page of your notifications, most recent notification first

column3: find a notification which is unseen (the icon on the right contains a solid black circle) and which has no action associated with it (it will say "Mark as seen" on the right)

column4: The black circle on the right becomes an empty circle

column3: find a notification which is unseen and requires action

column4: You are taken to an appropriate action page for the notification

column3: Go back to the search interface

column4: the notification you clicked on above is no longer marked as unseen (the black circle has become an empty circle)

column3: Hover your mouse over the "seen notification" icon (the empty circle).

column4: a tooltip appears which tells you the date the notification was marked as seen

column3: Hover your mouse over the resut type icon (next to/below the "seen notification" icon)

column4: a tooltip appears which tells you the nature of the notification

column3: Enter some search text in the search box and press enter

column4: your search results are limited to those containing the text in the search box
They are still ordered by date, most recent first

column3: Clear the search filter by removing the text and pressing enter

column4: your original unfiltered list of notifications is restored

column3: Try the other search controls, such as changing the page size and navigation to the next/previous page
